conclusion: Analyze the relationship between the magnetic field, the movement of the metal rod, and the induced electromotive force.

The image shows a uniform magnetic field with a metal rod initially perpendicular to the magnetic field lines. The rod is then bent into two segments, forming a right angle with each other, and placed in a plane perpendicular to the magnetic field.
Initially, the rod is perpendicular to the magnetic field, and it moves at speed v perpendicular to both the rod and the magnetic field. The induced electromotive force is ε.

When the rod is bent into two equal-length segments forming a right angle, the segments are perpendicular to the magnetic field. The rod moves at speed v along the angle bisector of the right angle formed by the segments.
The induced electromotive force for the bent rod is ε'.
The induced electromotive force is proportional to the component of the velocity perpendicular to the magnetic field. For the initial straight rod, the force is ε = vB.
For the bent rod, the force is ε' = (v/√2)B, because the velocity component perpendicular to the magnetic field is reduced by a factor of 1/√2.
